title: Work done moving charge around sphere

content.question: A conducting sphere has a net charge of <math alttext="positive uppercase Q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> . Points <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> are on opposite sides of the surface of the sphere, as shown. If a point charge <math alttext="positive lowercase q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><mtext>q</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is moved from point <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to point <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in a straight line through the center of the sphere, the work done to move the charge is <math alttext="W sub C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> . If a point charge <math alttext="positive lowercase q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><mtext>q</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is moved from point <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to point <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> along the surface of the sphere, the work done is <math alttext="W sub S" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> . Which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="W sub C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="W sub S" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and gives evidence to support this comparison?

choices.label: <math alttext="W sub S is greater than W sub C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow></msub><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>></mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the point charge is moved a greater distance for <math alttext="W sub S" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> than <math alttext="W sub S" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="W sub S is less than W sub C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow></msub><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo><</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, because no work is done only when the point charge moves along the surface.

<math alttext="W sub S is less than W sub C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow></msub><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo><</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, because there is more work done moving the charge to the center of the sphere and back to the surface than moving the charge along the surface.

<math alttext="W sub S equals W sub C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow></msub><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>=</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the displacement for each path is the same.

<math alttext="W sub S equals W sub C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow></msub><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>=</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, because no work is done along either path, regardless of displacement.

content.answer: <math alttext="W sub S equals W sub C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow></msub><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>=</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, because no work is done along either path, regardless of displacement.
